docs.title: Getting Started with grid-meta
docs.text:
View Full Documentation..

Welcome! Follow the steps below to get grid-meta up and running locally. We recommend using a Python virtual environment for a clean install 🔒🐍.

💡 Note: In the future, grid-meta may be installable directly via pip install gridmeta. For now, follow the instructions below.

docs.title: 📦 Step 1: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
First, download the codebase to your machine:

git clone https://github.com/Grid-Atlas/grid-meta.git
cd grid-meta

docs.title: 🧪 Step 2: Set Up a Python Environment
docs.text:
To avoid dependency conflicts, create and activate a virtual environment.

You can use any tool of your choice — here are a few popular options:

🟢 Option A: Using venv (Standard Library) 
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
🔵 Option B: Using conda 
conda create -n grid-reducer-env python=3.10
conda activate grid-reducer-env

docs.title: 🚀 Step 3: Install the Project Locally
docs.text:
Install the project in editable mode so changes to the code reflect immediately:

pip install -e .

✅ This will also install all required dependencies.

docs.title: 🛠 Example CLI Usage
docs.text:
You can currently use this package as CLI tool. To see the available commands please use following command.

gridmeta --help

Usage: gridmeta [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:
  --help  Show this message and exit.

Commands:
  extract-opendss-dehydrated-dataset

To extract opendss model dehydrated metadata you can use following command.

gridmeta extract-opendss-dehydrated-dataset -f tests\data\opendss\ieee13\master.dss -o test.json

You can specify privacy flag with -pm option.

gridmeta extract-opendss-dehydrated-dataset -f tests\data\opendss\ieee13\master.dss -pm "low" -o test.json

Make sure to pass appropriate file paths. You can also update model year, state, region type and description from command line. Defaults will be used if these are not provided.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Here is an example of extracted metadata for IEEE 13 opendss model.

    "state": "WA",
    "created_at": "2025-02-26T16:07:47.810263",

docs.title: Things to do if JSON schema for metadata changes
docs.text:
• Update the markdown files for doc by running following command from the root of the repo.

    python docs/doc.py

  • Also make update to python models by running bash-script codegen.sh.

  • Refactor where updates classes are used through out the code base.

docs.title: Testing markdown linting locally
docs.text:
To test linting errors for markdown files locally, you need to install following npm package.

npm install -g markdownlint-cli

After this you can run the following command to check for markdown linting errors. Make sure you are at the root of the repo.

markdownlint docs/**/*.md --config .markdownlint.yaml -i docs/schemas/**/*.md
markdownlint README.md --config .markdownlint.yaml
markdownlint CHANGELOG.md --config .markdownlint.yaml

docs.title: Testing spell check locally
docs.text:
To test spell check locally for markdown and python files, you need to install following npm package.

npm install -g cspell

After you install cspell you can run following command to test the spell check.

cspell --config .cspell.json "src/**/*.py" "docs/**/*.md" "README.md" "CHANGELOG.md"

docs.title: Metadata
docs.text: • Dehydration Metadata V1

docs.title: Capacitor item
docs.text: dehydration_metadata_v1 / distribution_system_assets / capacitors

docs.title: Capacitor Item
docs.text:
Type: object Additional Properties Allowed: True

Property Type Required Format Title kvar number Capacitor Capacity num_phase number Capacitor Number of Phase kv number Capacitor kV count number Capacitor Count

docs.title: kvar
docs.text:
Nameplate rating of capacitor in kvar.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 0.01

docs.title: num_phase
docs.text:
Number of phase for capacitor

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 1 Maximum Number: 3

docs.title: kv
docs.text:
Kilo volt rating for the capacitor.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 0.01

docs.title: count
docs.text:
Count of capacitors.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 1

docs.text: dehydration_metadata_v1 / distribution_system_assets

docs.title: Capacitors
docs.text: Type: array[capacitor_item]

docs.title: Dehydration Metadata V1
docs.text:
Type: object Additional Properties Allowed: True

Property Type Required Format Title metadata metadata Metadata assets distribution_system_assets Distribution System Assets voltage_metrics voltage_metrics Voltage Metrics

docs.title: metadata
docs.text:
Contains information about location, creation date and model year.

  • is required
  • Type: metadata

docs.title: assets
docs.text:
Object capturing high level asset information.

  • is required
  • Type: distribution_system_assets

docs.title: voltage_metrics
docs.text:
High level information about voltage metrics.

  • is required
  • Type: voltage_metrics

docs.title: Distribution Feeder Sections
docs.text: Type: array[feeder_section_item]

docs.title: Distribution system assets
docs.text: dehydration_metadata_v1

docs.title: Distribution System Assets
docs.text:
Type: object Additional Properties Allowed: True

Property Type Required Format Title transformers distribution_transformers Distribution Transformers feeder_sections distribution_feeder_sections Distribution Feeder Sections capacitors capacitors Capacitors switches switches Switches loads loads Loads

docs.title: transformers
docs.text:
Object capturing high level information about distribution transformers.

  • is not required
  • Type: distribution_transformers

docs.title: feeder_sections
docs.text:
High level information about feeder sections.

  • is not required
  • Type: distribution_feeder_sections

docs.title: capacitors
docs.text:
Object representing high level information about capacitors.

  • is not required
  • Type: capacitors

docs.title: switches
docs.text:
High level information about switches present in the model.

  • is not required
  • Type: switches

docs.title: loads
docs.text:
Represents high level load information.

  • is not required
  • Type: loads

docs.title: Feeder Section Item
docs.text:
Type: object Additional Properties Allowed: True

Property Type Required Format Title kv number Feeder Section Voltage num_phase number Feeder section number of phase. count number Feeder Section Count avg_feeder_miles number Average Feeder Miles min_feeder_miles number Minimum Feeder Miles max_feeder_miles number Maximum Feeder Miles std_feeder_miles number \| string Standard Deviation Feeder Miles min_ampacity number Minimum Feeder Ampacity avg_ampacity number Average Feeder Ampacity max_ampacity number Maximum Feeder Ampacity std_ampacity number \| string Standard Deviation Feeder Ampacity avg_per_unit_resistance_ohm_per_mile number Average Per Unit Resistance min_per_unit_resistance_ohm_per_mile number Minimum Per Unit Resistance max_per_unit_resistance_ohm_per_mile number Maximum Per Unit Resistance std_per_unit_resistance_ohm_per_mile number \| string Standard Deviation Per Unit Resistance avg_per_unit_reactance_ohm_per_mile number Average Per Unit Reactance min_per_unit_reactance_ohm_per_mile number Minimum Per Unit Reactance max_per_unit_reactance_ohm_per_mile number Maximum Per Unit Reactance std_per_unit_reactance_ohm_per_mile number \| string Standard Deviation Per Unit Reactance min_customers_served number Minimum number of customers served. avg_customers_served number Average number of customers served. max_customers_served number Maximum number of customers served. std_customers_served number \| string Standard Deviation number of customers served. min_pct_peak_loading number Minimum Percentage Peak Loading avg_pct_peak_loading number Average Percentage Peak Loading max_pct_peak_loading number Maximum Percentage Peak Loading std_pct_peak_loading number \| string Standard Deviation Percentage Peak Loading

docs.title: kv
docs.text:
Kilo volt rating of feeder section. Line to line for multi phase and line to ground for single phase.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 0.01

docs.title: num_phase
docs.text:
Number of phase for feeder section.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 1 Maximum Number: 3

docs.title: count
docs.text:
Number of feeder section for given voltage rating, num of phase and construction type.

  • is required
  • Type: number

Minimum Number: 1

docs.title: Metadata
docs.text:
Type: object Additional Properties Allowed: True

Property Type Required Format Title state unknown List U.S state to which model belongs to. created_at string date-time Created Datetime model_year integer Model Year info string Metadata Info region_type enum Feeder Category

docs.title: state
docs.text:
U.S State to which model belongs to.

  • is required
  • Type: unknown

docs.title: Any Of
docs.text: Minimum number of items: 1

docs.title: created_at
docs.text:
Data obfuscation date-time.

  • is required
  • Type: string

docs.title: model_year
docs.text:
Model year from which data is extracted.

  • is required
  • Type: integer

Regex Pattern: ^(19|20|21)\d{2}$

docs.title: info
docs.text:
Any description you would like to add.

  • is required
  • Type: string

docs.title: region_type
docs.text:
An enumeration of feeder categories representing it's area type.

  • is required
  • Type: enum
Value Urban Suburban Rural
